segments.en: 180–182. Desire, Etc. for the Suffering Exterior

segments.pli: “Yaṃ, bhikkhave, dukkhaṃ, tatra vo chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo.
segments.en: “Mendicants, you should give up desire … greed … desire and greed for what is suffering.

segments.pli: Rūpā, bhikkhave, dukkhā; tatra vo chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo.
segments.en: Sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and thoughts are suffering …”

segments.pli: dhammā dukkhā; tatra vo chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo.
Yaṃ, bhikkhave, dukkhaṃ, tatra vo chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo”ti.
